description: First past the post (FPTP) is the voting system used by most of the U.S. Every voter selects one candidate.
We'll represent votes as these colored dots.
Gracey Grey wins since she has the most votes, even though she didn't have a majority of votes.
This voting system encourages a two-party system, polarized candidates, and vote-splitting, and disincentives convincing voters outside your party to vote for you.
Let's take a closer look at how FPTP encourages a polarized, two-party system.
Ranked Choice Voting (RCV) is an alternative voting method used in Australia, as well in Maine and some Californian cities.
Every voter ranks each of the candidates.
